body.p: To His Excellency Gov. Thomas E. Bramlette. Gov. of Ky.

We the undersigned Jurors of the Jury who tried and convicted Wm. Schofield, at the October term of the Jefferson Criminal Court for 1863; and whose petition for his pardon accompanies this, would respectfully recommend his case to the your Excellency as one of merit; and one in which Executive clemency would be proper.

Respectfully.
Edwd J. Wilson
M. S. Gross
D J Bowles
Henry Dennis
F. W Merz
J. V. Escott
Squire Lochery
W. F. Lewis

This is to certify that I was one of the Jury who tried the afsd Wm Schofield; I was about Oakland about the time the money was alledged to have been Stolen; I knew Weaver ^he was a wagon master^. The man who lost the money, or said he lost it. I heard Weaver tell about it frequently; and he never heard him tell the Same Story twice; he was So frequently drunk; and he told so many different tales about it; and he had around him Such a bad Set a men; that I was led to beleave that it was uncertain whether he lost it at all; or if he did he I am Satisfied knew nothing about who got it. I was on the Jury and was greatly Susprized that Schofield plead guilty; we could not do anything else but find him So I Sign the petition with please and earnestly ask your executive clemency.
